mdRecord.dcterms:title: Apxaionomia: sive De priscis Anglorum legibus libri, sermone anglico, vetustate antiquissimo, aliquot abhinc seculis conscripti, atq; nunc demum, magno iurisperitorum, & amantium antiquitatis omnium commodo,è tenebris in lucem vocati / Gulielmo Lambardo interprete. Regum qui has leges scripserunt nomenclationem, et quid præterea accesserit, altera monstrabit pagina
Great Britain. Laws, etc
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Leges Inæ regis.--Legis Aluredi regis.--Fœdus Aluredi, & Guthruni regum.--Leges Edouardi regis.--Fœdus Edouardi & Guthruni, regum.--Leges Æthelstani regis.--Leges Edmundi regis.--Leges Edgari regis.--Leges Ethelredi regis.--Senatusconsultum de Monticolis VValliæ.--Legis Canuti regis.--Leges Gulielmi regis.--Leges boni regis Edouardi, quas Gulielmus Bastardus postea confirmault.
Title within ornamental border; initials; head and tail pieces.
Irregularities in foliation: leaf 85 repeated, leaf 87 omitted in numbering; leaves 74, 75 and 112 incorrectly numbered 72, 74, and 121, respectively.
First word in title transliterated from original Greek.
At foot of t.-p.: Cvm gratia et privilegio Regiæ Maiestatis per decemnium.
"This collection was originally made by Lawrance Nowell, who going abroad in 1657 [i. e. 1557?], left it to Lambarde to translate and publish."--Clarke, Bibliotheca legum.
The laws from Ina to Canute, inclusive, are in Anglo-Saxon and Latin on opposite pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Law, Anglo-Saxon
